intro: Ardisia glanduligera, commonly known as the glandular evergreen or Chinese beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright purple to red berries that are edible for birds but generally not for humans. Ardisia glanduligera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal fruit display. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade.
